title: Experimental features of the supercells package
text: default, original SLIC algorithm uses regularly distributed cluster centers, initial cluster centers overlapping “search window” neighbors. next experimental feature supercells possibility specifying custom cluster centers.4 can done providing sf object number points. sf object can read file, created manually, example :  want use custom cluster centers, need set k step arguments: k - provide sf object number points. step - provide size “search window”. impact setting different values step can seen examples . step set 10, many locations area segmented:  Increasing step value allows include locations segmentation process. However, also results many detached areas (tiny polygons connected directly main superpixels):  result made smooth allowing enforcement supercells’ connectivity:
code: set.seed(2021-11-21) custom_centers = sf::st_as_sfc(sf::st_bbox(ortho)) custom_centers = sf::st_sample(custom_centers, 100, type = "random") custom_centers = sf::st_sf(geom = custom_centers) plot(ortho) plot(st_geometry(custom_centers), add = TRUE) ortho_slic1 = supercells(ortho, k = custom_centers, step = 10,                           compactness = 1, clean = FALSE) plot(ortho) plot(st_geometry(ortho_slic1), add = TRUE, border = "red") ortho_slic2 = supercells(ortho, k = custom_centers, step = 20,                          compactness = 1, clean = FALSE) plot(ortho) plot(st_geometry(ortho_slic2), add = TRUE, border = "red") ortho_slic3 = supercells(ortho, k = custom_centers, step = 20,                          compactness = 1, clean = TRUE, minarea = 8) plot(ortho) plot(st_geometry(ortho_slic3), add = TRUE, border = "red")

title: Superpixels of a single raster layer
text: first step read input data. , going use volcano.tif example data already included supercells package.  contains digital elevation model Maunga Whau volcano, value represents elevation sea level. supercells package can used delineate areas similar elevations. one main function, supercells(), expects least three arguments: x - input raster (object class SpatRaster terra package) k - expected number superpixels compactness - compactness value. Larger values create compact/even (square) superpixels supercells() output sf object, row represents single superpixel. stores superpixels ids (supercells), coordinates superpixels’ centroids (x y), average input variables (elevation case). allows us plot superpixels’ borders top input raster data:  vol_slic1 object can final result analysis used grouping clustering.
code: vol = rast(system.file("raster/volcano.tif", package = "supercells")) plot(vol) vol_slic1 = supercells(vol, k = 50, compactness = 1) vol_slic1 plot(vol) plot(st_geometry(vol_slic1), add = TRUE, lwd = 0.2)

title: Superpixels of a single raster layer
text: supercells() function also set optional arguments, including: step - distance (number cells) initial superpixel’ centers. can used instead k dist_fun - distance function used calculate similarities raster values clean - connectivity superpixel enforced? FALSE, superpixels consist several nonadjacent regions. TRUE default. iter - number iterations performed create output. 10 default. Let’s try change values : output still structure (sf object superpixels ids, coordinates centroids, average input variables), slightly different number superpixels, borders bit different.
code: vol_slic2 = supercells(vol, step = 11, compactness = 1, dist_fun = "euclidean",                         clean = FALSE, iter = 10) plot(vol) plot(st_geometry(vol_slic2), add = TRUE, lwd = 0.2)

title: Creates supercells — supercells
text: x object class SpatRaster (terra) class stars (stars) k number supercells desired user (output number can slightly different!). can use either k step. also possible provide set points (sf object) k together step value create custom cluster centers. compactness compactness value. Larger values cause clusters compact/even (square). compactness value depends range input cell values selected distance measure. dist_fun distance function. Currently implemented distance functions "euclidean", "jsd", "dtw" (dynamic time warping), name distance function philentropy package (see philentropy::getDistMethods(); "log2" used case), user defined function accepting two vectors returning one value. Default: "euclidean" avg_fun averaging function - values supercells' centers calculated? accepts fitting R function (e.g., base::mean() stats::median()) one internally implemented "mean" "median". Default: "mean" clean connectivity supercells enforced? iter number iterations performed create output. transform Transformation performed input. default, transformation performed. Currently available transformation "to_LAB": first, conversion RGB LAB color space applied, supercells algorithm run, afterward, reverse transformation performed obtained results. (argument experimental may removed future). step distance (number cells) initial supercells' centers. can use either k step. minarea Specifies minimal size supercell (cells). works clean = TRUE. default, clean = TRUE, average area () calculated based total number cells divided number supercells Next, minimal size supercell equals /(2^2) (right shifted) metadata Logical. TRUE, output object metadata columns ("supercells", "x", "y"). FALSE, output object metadata columns. chunks input (x) split chunks deriving supercells? Either FALSE (default), TRUE (large input objects split), numeric value (representing side length chunk number cells). future future package used parallelization calculations? Default: FALSE. TRUE, also need specify future::plan(). verbose integer specifying level text messages printed calculations. 0 means messages (default), 1 provides basic messages (e.g., calculation stage).
